channel.title: Technical problem VM
channel.description:
Hello guys I have some technical problem.
I run my whonix in my virtualBox.But i can't establish network connection.
I'm sure host network is all right.
This is my situationÔºö My host OS:OS X VM:VirtualBox VM network setting:NAT
Waiting for reply.üòä PS:I'm in CHINA MAINLAND NOW,does Chinese government block Tor network very seriously?

item.title: Technical problem VM
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Forget about the ‚Äúnetwork interface unmanaged‚Äù thing. Technically it‚Äôs a non-issue. It‚Äôs just a distraction. Usability issue. No action required.

Concentrate on https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Bridges. That‚Äôs all. No other changes.

Read full topic

item.title: Technical problem VM
item.dc:creator: gungesc
item.description:
Patrick:

This is not a problem apart from a confusing usability issue.

So how should i do?
I use whonix in VirtualBox.Host OS is OS X. And network setting is NAT.But in whoinx notice"network interface unmanaged"
The "https://wiki.debian.org/NetworkManager,http://www.blackmoreops.com/2013/11/25/how-to-fix-wired-network-interface-device-not-managed-error/"said i should enable network manager.But i need enable root user How to enable root user in whonix?

Read full topic
